page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT ON THE LAND
page.content: Most of the land in the block is used for arable farming, but this is now mechanised and is no longer the labour intensive industry that it used to be. The majority of farms are privately owned and worked by the owner and his family. There are still 5 working farms in{Elston}and 4 in{East Stoke.} Two of the farms in{East Stoke}are unusual in that they still employ several farmhands - 7 on one farm, 5 on another. One of the farms in{East {Stoke}which includes much of the land of{Stoke Hall}is owned by the national glass company,{Pilkingtons,}and farmed by a manager.
